syntax:
java [ options ] mainclass [ argument … ]
java [ options ] -jar file.jar [ argument … ]
java [ options ] -jar file.jar mainclass [ argument … ] if the main class is not defined in the jar file

-Xmsn set the initial size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool
The value must be a multiple of 1024 greater than 1MB.
Append the letter k or K to indicate kilobytes, or m or M to indicate megabytes.

-Xmxn set the maximum size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool
The value must be a multiple of 1024 greater than 2MB.
Append the letter k or K to indicate kilobytes, or m or M to indicate megabytes.
-Xssn set the thread stack size
-Dproperty=value set a system property value

ROW.DESC:
Specifies a list of directories, JAR files, and ZIP archives to search for class files.
On Windows, semicolons (;) separate entities in this list; on other platforms it is a colon (:).
Specifying classpath overrides any setting of the CLASSPATH environment variable. If the class path option isn't used and classpath isn't set, then the user class path consists of the current directory.
As a special convenience, a class path element that contains a base name of an asterisk (*) is considered equivalent to specifying a list of all the files in the directory with the extension .jar or .JAR.
